target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From March 30, the South Sudan Ministry of Health has begun a public awareness campaign across the country about COVID-19, in cooperation with UNICEF and WHO.
As of April 15, health authorities in Jonglei State have started creating awareness about the dangers of the novel coronavirus in the greater Akobo area.

description: From April 29, South Sudan has recommended the use of cloth face masks at all times.

description: From March 16, South Sudan orders a fourteen-day quarantine for travelers who "have just arrived from countries with established local infection and transmission of COVID-19".

description: From March 21, any traveler entering South Sudan from a country affected by COVID-19 will be quarantined for 14 days at an isolation facility at their own expense. UPDATE: The original quarantine was a self-quarantine, travelers will now be quarantined in a government facility.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: On April 6, a total of 31 inmates were released in Yirol County of South Sudan’s Lakes State as part of efforts to control the spread of the new coronavirus pandemic.

description: On April 13, Authorities in Lakes State temporarily released 143 prisoners to reduce overcrowding in Rumbek prison.

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On April 20, South Sudan ordered the release of 1400 prisoners to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in prisons. The prisoners released are to be "pre-trial detainees and prisoners who have served most of their terms."
type_sub_cat: Prison population reduced (e.g. early release of prisoners)

description: On April 20, South Sudan recommended commuting the sentences of juvenile offenders and prisoners with less than six months remaining on their sentences.

description: On April 28, authorities in Jonglei State have temporarily freed more than 80 inmates in the town of Bor as coronavirus fears grow in the state. The official pointed out the inmates released were those with minor cases.

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On May 11, authorities in Jonglei State have temporarily released 20 inmates from jail in Twic East County as part of efforts to control the spread of the coronavirus pandemic. The inmates were on minor offences awaiting trial.

description: On August 21, South Sudan's mosques have opened their doors to worshippers for the first time in five months as the government eased restrictions imposed to combat the coronavirus pandemic. description: Churches in Maridi County prepare to reopen after months of closure following the coronavirus pandemic. The Episcopal Church of South Sudan parishes will resume public worship services from Sunday 6th September 2020. Bishop Moses Zungo of the Episcopal Church of South Sudan Diocese of Maridi told Radio Tamazuj that the churches will observe the ministry of health guidelines and measures for the prevention of the spread of coronavirus.
